gobblin.fork

Class Forker

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.fork.Forker

  • public class Forker
extends Object
    Forks a RecordStreamWithMetadata into multiple branches specified by a ForkOperator. Each forked stream is a mirror of the original stream.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Forker.ForkedStream<D,S>
      An object containing the forked streams and a ConnectableFlowable used to connect the stream when all streams have been subscribed to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Forker()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      <D,S> Forker.ForkedStream<D,S> forkStream(RecordStreamWithMetadata<D,S> inputStream, ForkOperator<S,D> forkOperator, WorkUnitState workUnitState)
      Obtain the Forker.ForkedStream for the input RecordStreamWithMetadata and ForkOperator.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • forkStream

        public <D,S> Forker.ForkedStream<D,S> forkStream(RecordStreamWithMetadata<D,S> inputStream,
                                                 ForkOperator<S,D> forkOperator,
                                                 WorkUnitState workUnitState)
                                          throws Exception
        Obtain the Forker.ForkedStream for the input RecordStreamWithMetadata and ForkOperator.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input Flowable of records.
        forkOperator - ForkOperator specifying the fork behavior.
        workUnitState - work unit configuration.
        Returns:
        a Forker.ForkedStream with the forked streams.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the ForkOperator throws any exceptions.
